title: 50 Ways To Keep The Spark Alive In Your Relationship
summary: The best ways to keep the spark alive in your relationship is to go on dates together. Take care of yourself, take care of your health and take up a new hobby. Reconnect with your partner’s little idiosyncrasies to bring you closer together. Try surprising your partner with a small gift – even something as simple as a card with a special message inside – or doing something thoughtful to help relieve their stress. Planning a trip together doesn’t have to be hard – you can go almost anywhere.

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"Go on a Date"),mdx("p",null,"You might have heard this one before, but it\u2019s for a good reason: dates are great for bringing the romance back into your relationship. If you\u2019ve been together for years, you might have gotten into the habit of meeting for dinner every night \u2013 but that can get pretty old, pretty fast."),mdx("p",null,"Try to mix things up. Maybe you order in, or go to a casual restaurant. Or, throw a dinner party at home by inviting your partner\u2019s closest friends along. Another option is to go on an adventure together: try rock climbing, or skydiving, or even go on a hike in the wilderness. You\u2019ll both have fun, and you\u2019ll have something to remember for a lifetime."),mdx("h2",null,"Communicate, Communicate, Communicate"),mdx("p",null,"If there\u2019s one thing all couples have in common, it\u2019s the need for more communication. And while this is something that\u2019s often talked about, it\u2019s rarely ever followed through with. You\u2019ll get nowhere if you\u2019re not honest with your partner about how you\u2019re feeling. Even if you\u2019re not in a serious romantic relationship, communication is key to any relationship \u2013 romantic or not. If you aren\u2019t communicating your feelings, thoughts, or desires, how does your partner know what you need? How does your partner know how you are feeling? It can be scary, but you\u2019ll both feel a lot less stressed if you\u2019re open and honest with each other."),mdx("h2",null,"Reconnect With Your Partner\u2019s Language"),mdx("p",null,"We all have our little idiosyncrasies. Things that make us who we are, and things that make us feel connected to those around us. It\u2019s a good idea to keep in mind what your partner\u2019s little quirks are, so you can use them to bring you closer together. For example: maybe your partner always drinks their coffee black. If so, you could always join them for a cup."),mdx("p",null,"Or, maybe your partner always leaves the lights on when they leave the room. If so, you could always follow suit. Little things like these can help you reconnect with your partner\u2019s language. And when you come together with your partner, you can use your own quirks to connect with theirs."),mdx("h2",null,"Surprise Each Other"),mdx("p",null,"Some couples get into a rut where they are expected to be the ones bringing gifts, flowers or do other romantic gestures. It\u2019s easy to fall into this trap \u2013 and even easier to get out of it. Try surprising your partner with a small gift \u2013 even something as simple as a card with a special message inside \u2013 or doing something thoughtful to help relieve their stress. Gift cards are appropriate in many situations, but you can also be creative and thoughtful with your ideas."),mdx("p",null,"If your partner is stressed with work, try picking up their groceries for them, or washing their car. If your partner is stressed with school, try bringing them coffee in the morning on the way to the bus stop, or pack them a lunch. There are lots of ways to surprise your partner and it is an excellent way to stay connected while not spending a lot of money."),mdx("h2",null,"Go On A Trip Together"),mdx("p",null,"This is one of the best ways to keep the romance alive and reignite the passion you shared early in your relationship. Planning a trip for you and your partner doesn\u2019t have to be hard \u2013 you can go almost anywhere. Whether it\u2019s a weekend getaway, or a trip to another city, a vacation brings you together as a couple and gives you something to look forward to."),mdx("p",null,"There are many ways to plan a trip, but you should start by determining your budget. From there, you can begin to plan. You can use a travel website to help plan your trip or even check out a travel book from the library. After determining your budget, you can begin to narrow down locations and activities that fit into your budget."),mdx("h2",null,"Take Care Of Yourself"),mdx("p",null,"One of the easiest ways to keep the spark alive is by taking care of yourself. You should always be taking care of yourself, regardless of your relationship status, but it\u2019s especially important once you\u2019re in a romantic relationship. Take time for yourself \u2013 whether that\u2019s going for a walk, seeing a therapist, or taking up a new hobby, you both need and deserve it."),mdx("p",null,"If you\u2019ve been neglecting yourself, it will show in your relationship. Taking care of yourself allows you to be an even better partner to your significant other. You don\u2019t have to do anything fancy; just commit to taking care of your mental, physical, and emotional health."),mdx("h2",null,"Add New Activities To Your Routine Together"),mdx("p",null,"One of the best ways to keep the spark alive in your relationship is to mix things up. Try adding new activities to your routine with your partner. Whether it\u2019s going to a concert together, or taking up a new sport, getting out and doing new things as a couple will help you stay connected to one another. It\u2019s easy to fall into a routine when you\u2019ve been in a relationship for a while. You both might have a lot of other responsibilities that take up your time, but don\u2019t let them get in the way of enjoying your relationship."),mdx("p",null,"Find ways to incorporate new activities into your routine together. Even if it\u2019s just going to the library together or taking a walk around the block every night, new activities can help you stay connected and keep the spark alive in your relationship."),mdx("h2",null,"Watch Movies Or Shows That Resonate With Your Relationship Together"),mdx("p",null,"There are plenty of movies and shows out there that have themes that resonate with relationships. Why not watch them together and talk about what they represent for you and your partner? It\u2019s a great way to open the discussion and get things flowing between you."),mdx("p",null,"Some movies and shows couples might want to watch together include: Titanic, The Notebook, Jerry McGuire, Love Actually, Dirty Dancing, Sleepless in Seattle, When Harry Met Sally, Pride and Prejudice, and An Affair to Remember."),mdx("h2",null,"Ask For What You Want And Need From Your Partner"),mdx("p",null,"Finally, one of the best ways to keep the spark alive in your relationship is to ask for what you want and need from your partner. It\u2019s easy to get comfortable in a relationship and to forget to ask for what you want. You might need your partner to spend more time with you, or you might want them to help out around the house more. Whatever it is, don\u2019t be afraid to open the discussion up and ask for what you want."),mdx("p",null,"Your partner will appreciate being asked for what you need, and you\u2019ll both feel more connected as a result. It\u2019s also a good way to start the conversation about any problems or issues you might be having in the relationship."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Make Your Home More Energy Efficient

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`As the cost of living continues to rise, it\u2019s more important than ever for Americans to find ways to save money and stay within a budget. After all, no one wants to feel like they\u2019re drowning in bills every month.
To that end, everyone could probably stand to tighten their belts a little bit when it comes to their day-to-day expenses; after all, there are several small things we can do on a daily basis that will collectively add up and help us save money in the long run. In this blog post, we\u2019ll cover everything you need to know about energy efficiency at home and how you can start saving money by making your house more efficient today!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Out of a Style Rut

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The risk of falling into a style rut is something we all have to deal with from time to time. It happens to even the most confident and daring of people, so you\u2019re certainly not alone if you feel like your style is stagnating and you can\u2019t think of anything new or exciting to wear. Whether it\u2019s because you haven\u2019t found a new piece of clothing that excites you in months, or because you just don\u2019t know what to wear after wearing variations on the same theme for several weeks in a row, everyone gets stuck in a rut now and again. Thankfully there are ways to get out of it and discover a new lease on your personal style once again."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How the Pandemic Is Changing the Way We Work

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Time is money, as the saying goes. And when you\u2019re grappling with pandemic disease and a global outbreak, time spent at work has a whole different set of implications.
Pandemic flu strains have decimated human populations since the first recorded pandemic in 541 AD. Over the centuries, outbreaks have been frequent enough to instill fear in even the most stoic among us.
Today we face another pandemic threat with the potential to be even more devastating than those which came before it. A highly virulent strain of influenza A virus known as influenza pandemia has begun spreading rapidly throughout much of the world.
In many ways, today\u2019s workplace is very different from that of a century ago. Technology has advanced; office structures are more open and collaborative; and workers are expected to demonstrate self-motivation and flexibility in order to thrive in an ever-changing workplace environment.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Cut down on Screen Time
5 Ways to save Money as a College Student
How to Make Your Resolution to Get Fit a Reality
How to Get through a Break-Up

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Everyone knows break-ups are tough. Even if you know the relationship is ending, the final moments can still be filled with pain and heartbreak. However, a breakup doesn\u2019t need to be final in every sense of the word. In time, you will recover from your failed relationship and move on with your life. Here are some effective ways to make this happen sooner rather than later.
If you\u2019ve recently broken up with your partner or dating partner, it can feel like the end of the world. But it\u2019s not! A relationship coming to an end does not mean there is something wrong with you or that you aren\u2019t good enough for anyone or that you will never find love again. Your heart is broken at this moment because you cared deeply about this person - now you just have to understand why and how things went south so that it doesn\u2019t happen again in your future relationships`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Your Hobbies

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you love something, it feels like there\u2019s not enough time in the day to do everything you want to do. But at the same time, when you don\u2019t have anything that fills your days with joy and meaning, it feels like there are not enough hours in a week. Many people struggle with finding time for their hobbies. They either feel too busy or believe that they simply don\u2019t have the opportunities to pursue something they enjoy. This feeling is understandable\u2014because most people lead incredibly busy lives. Work, school, family, friends, and other obligations take up a lot of time and energy. So how can you carve out some time for your hobbies? It might seem impossible right now\u2014but trust us, it\u2019s possible! Even if your schedule feels full beyond measure right now, there are always little cracks of space that can grow and expand into larger windows of opportunity."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Tips for Eating Healthy on a Budget

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you trying to eat healthier but find that healthy foods are expensive? Are you trying to make a good meal last for several days and not just one? Are you struggling to find affordable, healthy options near your home or work? If so, you\u2019re not alone. Eating healthy can be expensive and challenging. The cost of healthy food has gone up while the cost of unhealthy food has gone down. But this doesn\u2019t mean that eating healthy is impossible; it just means we all need to get a little bit more creative.
Eating well on a budget can be challenging, but it isn\u2019t impossible. Making smart choices about what you buy as well as how you cook your food can make a big difference in how much money you spend on food each month and how healthy your diet is at the same time.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Ultimate Guide to Spring Cleaning Your Home

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Home cleaning in spring is the best time to thoroughly clean your home. As the weather gets warmer, so does our house. Dirt and grime that has accumulated over the long winter months begins to dissipate as we put away all of our heavy coats, hats, and gloves. With fewer layers to trap it, dust, germs, and other nasty particles are exposed for what they really are: gross!
We all know that a tidy home is a happy one. Keeping a tidy household at all times can be challenging. The pressures of work and other responsibilities often get in the way of keeping things clean and organized. But with some preparation and planning you can make spring home cleaning your primary focus instead of an afterthought. Here\u2019s how\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
